constexpr T&amp; value() &amp;;

{{dcl|num=2|since=c++23|
constexpr const T&amp; value() const&amp;;
}}
{{dcl|num=3|since=c++23|
constexpr T&amp;&amp; value() &amp;&amp;;
}}
{{dcl|num=4|since=c++23|

}}
{{dcl h|{{c/core|void}} partial specialization}}
{{dcl|num=5|since=c++23|
constexpr void value() const&amp;;
}}
{{dcl|num=6|since=c++23|
constexpr void value() &amp;&amp;;
}}
{{dcl end}}

If {{c|*this}} contains an expected value, returns a reference to the contained value. Returns nothing for {{c/core|void}} partial specialization.

Otherwise, throws an exception of type {{c/core|std::bad_expected_access&lt;std::decay_t&lt;E&gt;&gt;}} that contains a copy of {{rlpf|error}}.

@1,2@ If {{c|std::is_copy_constructible_v&lt;E&gt;}} is {{c|false}}, the program is ill-formed.

@3,4@ If {{c|std::is_copy_constructible_v&lt;E&gt;}} or {{c|std::is_constructible_v&lt;E, decltype(std::move(error()))&gt;}} is {{c|false}}, the program is ill-formed.

@5@ If {{c|std::is_copy_constructible_v&lt;E&gt;}} is {{c|false}}, the program is ill-formed.

@6@ If {{c|std::is_move_constructible_v&lt;E&gt;}} is {{c|false}}, the program is ill-formed.

===Return value===
@1,2@ {{box|{{rlpi|/#Data members|val}}}}

@3,4@ {{box|{{c/core|std::move(}}{{tti|val}}{{c/core|)}}}}

===Exceptions===
@1,2,5@ Throws {{c|std::bad_expected_access(std::as_const(error()))}} if {{c|*this}} contains an unexpected value.

@3,4,6@ Throws {{c|std::bad_expected_access(std::move(error()))}} if {{c|*this}} contains an unexpected value.
